course.subject: TEMG
course.name: Special Project: Inter-varsity Entrepreneur Competition: Finance, Technology, Disruption
course.description: The purpose of the inter varsity entrepreneur competition is to create an opportunity for aspiring young students under the age of 25 to work in a multi-discipline and multi-cultural environment to develop startup businesses leveraging breakthroughs in customer insight, technology, business innovation to impact a lot of lives. The pedagogy of the competition relies on an intensive residential period with fellow students from around the world including daily combination of student teamwork, company visits, field research, coaching by mentors with different specialties and iterations of startup pitching. Students should expect to commit 10 to 12 hours per day in a highly intensive, competitive and demanding environment. Some information will be gathered from primary sources in the local language while all discussion, planning and presentations will be conducted in the English language at all times. Prior to the trip, each participating universities will prepare students with business planning skills and subject matter familiarity such that they “hit the ground running”. Each university should design pre-trip activities to familiarize students with finance industry domain, Fintech landscape, lean startup process, business model canvas technique, business plan presentation and cross-culture teamwork. All students are to adhere to international teaming etiquette and use the English language at all times for an immersive international culture experience. Enrollment in the project course requires approval of the course instructor.
